items.q: Which instrument is known for having a slide to change pitches?
items.explanation: The player moves the slide back and forth to alter the length of the tubing, which changes the pitch.

items.q: A solo is a piece of music performed by three people.
items.explanation: A solo is performed by a single person.

items.q: Pop music is generally written to appeal to a wide audience.
items.explanation: Pop music often features catchy melodies and relatable lyrics designed for commercial success.

items.a: Acapella singing is performing vocal music without any instrumental accompaniment.
items.explanation: The singers provide all the harmony and rhythm using only their voices.

items.a: A symphony is a large-scale musical composition, typically divided into several movements, written for an orchestra.
items.explanation: It is a major form of classical music.

items.q: What makes a grand piano different in shape from an upright piano?
items.a: A grand piano's strings and soundboard are horizontal and extend outward from the keyboard, whereas an upright piano sits vertically against a wall.
items.explanation: The horizontal layout gives the grand piano a much larger footprint.

items.a: Hip-hop is a genre characterized by rhythmic, rhyming speech (rapping) over an instrumental background beat.
items.explanation: It originated in the Bronx, New York, in the 1970s.

items.a: A concert is a live music performance in front of an audience.
items.explanation: Concerts can range from small club shows to massive stadium tours.

items.a: An instrumental track is a recorded song or piece of music that only features instruments, with no vocals or singing.
items.explanation: Instrumentals focus entirely on the musical arrangement.

items.q: Elvis Presley is often known by what royal nickname?
items.a: The King of Rock and Roll.
items.explanation: He was a pioneering figure in popularizing rockabilly and rock music.
